after about 2months of use of iphone 5 , i think i can now give my verdict. i have been a nokia user all my life until now, i changed to apple because i wanted a secure operating system not easily prone to crashes and viruses, most of the nokia phones i used have at one time crashed even the one i used before the iphone 5 , the nokia e6. the iphone 5 is a very beautiful phone and really safe and works perfectly well especially the auto-correct keyboard which makes it work so well instead of making a larger screen iphone for a larger keyboard, so i advise apple to keep the restrictions on it because thats the reason why someone like me changed over to apple. i cant but comment on some draw backs though, the messaging is not well compartmentallised to sent,inbox,draft,received messages, delivery report and an extra folder to keep important messages like in my nokia e6,then i had to buy an application in app store to be able to send a contact card to people and even with that , i'm still unable to receive any contact card sent to the phone. i hope ios 7 will correct these issues. overall its the best phone out there and apple should keep the 4inch screen, anything bigger is probably not good. keep also the closed/restricted operating system as this protects the phone.
